text: Hello everyone! I have a question about blog(but i don't know if this is the correct channel...may be themes?): can i create a module in the blog post template to insert an image in the header?

<@U01KL53R4LD> you can use an image widget or any custom module and code it directly into the template however you would like. If you want to just have an image selector you can use an image widget and set export_to_template_context=true on it and then reference it in your html markup however you need.
Hi <@UQWGKUEN7>! Thank you for this tip! For the moment i would like to use the easiest solution (in terms of time and maintenace): may be i'll use the first option.
<@UQWGKUEN7> another question: if i custom a widget/module to insert my image in the header have i to consider columns?

Well it kind of depends on how you have your template is structured. Are you trying to just make a custom full width banner image for each blog post? You could do a few things in that case. 1) Make use of the featured image in settings for this 2) add your own custom field or module and place it in the correct place in your blog template. Then style it accordingly.

Does that help at all?
In short - if youre trying to add an image to a section that is built using the HubSpot scaffolding then yes you will need to be conscious of columns.
<@UQWGKUEN7> Thanks again. Tomorrow i ll try your tips.
